content.title: Coffee Development Programme in North Eastern Region: Quality Upgradation / Certification: Support for Eco-Certification / Organic Certification
content.beneficiary: Coffee growers, particularly SHGs/collectives of tribal growers
content.details: The scheme aims to encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high-value specialty markets through the production of eco-certified coffees. It also encourages small growers to form groups/collectives for eco-certification.
benefits: 75% of the certification cost for Organic Certification spread over 3 years or the conversion period, whichever is less.
75% of the certification cost for other eco-certifications for one year.
eligibility: Applicants should be SHGs/collectives of tribal growers who obtain certification of their plantations for various sustainability and quality standards.
Support is available only for certification of estates as per Organic, Fair Trade, Rainforest Alliance, UTZ Certified, Bird friendly/Shade grown coffee standards, or equivalent programs.
Applicants must be certified as per the National Programme for Organic Production (NPOP) standards.
Certification must be obtained from accredited Certification Agencies.
content.application_process: Offline. The process includes certification completion, document submission to the Coffee Board, scrutiny, field inspection, review, and approval for subsidy disbursement.
documents_required: Application in the prescribed format (in duplicate).
Certificate of incorporation/registration, memorandum of article of association/society as Grower Collective/SHG/Cooperative.
Copy of the certificate issued by the Accredited Certification Agency.
Original invoice towards the cost of certification.
Copy of the Bank Pass Book containing account details.

faqs.question: What specific eco-certifications are eligible for support under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme supports certifications such as Organic, Fair Trade, Rainforest Alliance, UTZ Certified, and equivalent programs.

faqs.question: Could a collective of tribal growers apply for this scheme individually?
faqs.answer: The scheme necessitates tribal growers to form SHGs or collectives to access support.

faqs.question: What is the period over which the 75% subsidy for organic certification is distributed?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is allocated over three years or the conversion period, whichever is shorter.

faqs.question: Are applicants obliged to adhere to specific national standards?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must obtain certification in accordance with NPOP standards.

faqs.question: What are the steps involved in claiming the subsidy after certification?
faqs.answer: Submission of requisite documents to the Coffee Board, followed by scrutiny, field inspection, review, and approval.
